data.title: Great Chinese Food
data.text:
I have been going here for years but when I went by last week, it appears that they have closed.
Sad, because it was always good.

data.title: Used to be Better
data.text:
It seems more and more frequent these days that, in an effort to squeeze out every last penny of profit, many restaurants are squeezing out quality to do it.
While we still but food from here on occasion, we prefer a couple of other nearby (but farther) restaurants.

data.title: consistently excellent
data.text: extremely friendly folks.  the owner(s) are always there and make you feel so welcome.  the food is consistently very good. service cannot be beat. their server. Angel, is spot on....always.  i usually eat here once or twice a week.  have tried just about everything on their menu.  they will, and do accommodate food allergies.  so glad they are around.

data.title: OK Chinese food in the Tamarac area
data.text: There are many small family run "generic" Chinese restaurants in FL. They all seem to have almost the same menus. Everyone seems to order the complete lunch or dinner, with includes soup, egg roll, main dish, fried rice (dark with too much soy sauce), and ice cream. In such restaurants it is rare to find a person of Chinese background eating there! The food is not authentic Chinese food. This is one such restaurant. However, I found the food to be above average and the service was helpful and very friendly. Our party of eight ordered the ribs, pork with garlic sauce, moo goo gai pan, and orange beef.  All seemed good.

data.title: Fortune Dragon
data.text: Fortune Dragon has a family staff, well maintained. We found the restaurant clean. Susan and I had tea, Michael a coke. We all had dried noodles, and sweet and hot sauce. Susan had white rice, won ton soup, chicken chow mein, Michael and I had rice, won ton soup, garlic chicken.

data.title: Excellent Food
data.text: Every time I either eat in or take out the food is always fantastic! Whatever I get it is always "top notch". Not only is the food great; but, the service is wonderful. You are always welcome from the minute you walk thru the door to being seated and served.

data.title: LOOKS DIRTY
data.text:
Upon reading the excellent reviews my friends  & I decided to give Fortune Dragon a try. As soon as I walked in, I wanted to walk out! But I couldnt as 1 of my friends drove quite a distance & I didnt want to upset the apple cart. Anyway, the decor is appalling, dark, dingy, the carpet looked 30 yrs old with all that entails! The chairs are  VERY uncomfortable, the walls & doors to kitchen were dirty. (I guess they never heard of paint) There were sodas & drinks stacked in the last booth & along the corridor to bathroom. Speaking of the bathroom that left a lot to be desired too. Cleaning products were left in the open, the faucets were well beyond what anyone could do to make them shine/look clean. It was a functional bathroom. It just gives an icky feeling like the rest of the building. Also the walls needed painting in there & the corridor as well.  As far as the food goes it was fine, nothing to rave about but the prices were reasonable with generous portions. Wait staff was friendly, but I ordered first & my meal came out last..she apologized tho. I didnt like the way she set the table, she practically slammed the utensils down on the napkin..unprofessional. Furthermore she did not give us her name. 
If they spruce up the place, & get storage solutions for all those drinks, it would a much more appealing restaurant to visit.  I dont understand why no other reviewer didnt mention how terrible this place looks. Not going back anytime soon. But if decent value for generous portions are more important than appearances then by all means try it.

data.title: Disappointing....
data.text: It's so hard to find a good Chinese place where the food is seasoned and well prepared. I thought I found a gem in fortune dragon but after getting sick on 2 different occasions, I am unable to sacrifice my health any longer. The food tastes really good and when I got sick the food was not stale or had any bad odors to warn away from eating it, so it is very disappointing that I have to restart my Chinese food Search...

data.title: Excellent every time
data.text: I've always done take-out only here, so I can't speak to the dining-in experience.  My take-out experience, however, has always been fabulous.  I don't like calling in orders, so I have always just walked in, ordered, and waited.  I've never waited more than 15 minutes for my order, which is always piping hot.  One thing that was different was that when I ordered sweet and sour chicken, and my wife ordered honey chicken, was that they gave us the tempura-battered chicken with no sauces on it.  Both sauces were in their own separate containers.  My wife liked that, because it allowed us to have a slightly larger or smaller portion than we would have normally.  I asked my 10 year old how his lo mein was, and he gave a "Grmmff" with two thumbs up, so I'm assuming he was saying it was good.  The gentleman at the counter is always friendly and cheerful, and by my third visit to order take-out, was talking to me like an old friend, discussing 80's cartoons, upcoming movies, favorite books, etc.  My dinner combo (sweet and sour chicken, pork-fried rice, egg roll, and soup) always comes to around $8, and lasts me for two meals.  The lo mein lasted a few more meals for my son.  Overall, a great place for Chinese food.

data.title: To tired to drive
data.text: After a long grueling day at the beach, sun tanning and swimming, I had no desire to go out and eat. I found a brochure for Chinese food, and they DELIVERED. Not expecting much, but very hungry! My surprize was very intense.  The delivery was prompt, and the portions immense.  Someone really knows how to cook authentic chinese food The egg drop soup was outstanding. My shrimp in garlic sauce delicious.  The pork fried rice had huge chunks of roasted pork. This place rocks.. Job well done FD

data.title: Not flavorful enough for me
data.text: The dinner combination is very generous for its price and the servers were quick and so thankful. The hot and sour soup was bland - I didn't find any pork in it and despite its name, I only tasted soy and water. Recommend that the family find another food distributor for their egg rolls, as the filling was 99% cabbage with a little barbeque pork - again, bland. The pork fried rice was so dark, as if it had been dunked in soy sauce, and flavorless. The bright spot was the moo goo gai pan - the chicken was succulent, the veggies were crisp, and the sauce was delicious. I declined the free ice cream but it seemed to be a hit with the other diners in the restaurant.

data.title: Great dinner
data.text: We are always looking for new chinese places. The ones around us  are just not that great. We saw the reviews here and decided to take a drive. Very happy we did! The service was excellent, and the food was wonderful. I even purchased extra dinners to bring home it was so good. Prices were excellent. The only thing I would change would be the rice. My husband thought  it was good so maybe it was just me but I felt it was a little dried out. The sauce on my pork was simply devine so I added it to the rice. All in all it was fantastic and we would definitely  return!

data.title: so consistent, you tend to take them for granted
data.text: family owned, family run, and family chef.  unbeatable combination.  always friendly owners are on site.  food, not just the "ordinary" american chinese, is excellent.  their dishes in oyster sauce and black bean sauce are a delight.

data.title: Great Value for Money and Taste
data.text: I ordered take out because I have a $5 dollar off coupon for orders over $35, and I wasn't disappointed. I ordered fried chicken wings, pork chow fun, combination general tso's fried tofu dinner and mongolian beef. All was good, and I requested extra spicy for the Mongolian beef and it was exactly extra spicy, so that was good. This is definitely my go to take out in the future.

data.title: Best chinese food in south florida.
data.text: I have been coming here for years I love it. I have visited many chinese food restaurants from LA to SoFlo and this has been the best. Don't bother with anywhere else... ever again. Or else.

data.title: Great lunch specials
data.text: I ate lunch here because i had an appointment in the hospital across the road and there is no other food nearby.I was very happy to see a long list of lunch specials in a spacious clean old style Chinese restaurant. The food I ordered Hunan pork was served with a large amount of white rice and wonton soup with delicious crispy noodles.The service was excellent and very friendly. People who were regulars came in and were greeted. I plan to return to Fortune Dragon the next time I have an appointment at the hospital.

data.title: Why this Restaurant is not #1 ( You )
data.text:
Came to this area to go on a cruise. I live in Florida and I love Chinese food. The problem is in Florida it is very hard to find good Chinese food. Upon my second visit to this restaurant, The server acted as if  she had known me forever, she was glad to see me. Everything was super fresh and homemade. 
The reason this restaurant is not number one you have an eating here and gave your review. Please see the pictures of the food I have posted amazing.

data.title: Best Fried Rice !!!
data.text: I have eaten in many Chinese Restaurants across the Country, including New York and Chinatown in San Francisco.  I can honestly say that Fortune Dragon, Tamarac has the best Fried Rice I have ever eaten !!!  It's not just "Yellow colored White Rice" like most Chinese Restaurants but truly Authentic Wok/Pan "Fried Rice" and it's always Loaded with Meat, Egg and Vegetables !!  If you have never experienced Fortune Dragon's Fried Rice, I urge you to try it...I guarantee, you will not be disappointed !!  friends who moved to other parts of the Country have told me how much they miss Fortune Dragons Food and Fried Rice here in South Florida.  Trust me...If you don't order anything else (But their food is just as great...), please, Give Fortune's Fried Rice a try !!!

data.title: To Dine at Fortune Dragon you are Fortunate
data.text:
As a native New Yorker, finding a good Chinese Restaurant in South Florida is a challenge.  Fortunately for me and my family, we stumbled upon Fortune Dragon.  

As for the food, it is fresh, cooked to order and nothing is processed.  This is important to us since we are very much into natural health.

It is not just the food, it is the people.  I am a firm believer that people will buy from people they like.  Well at this establishment, the owner is so personable, you almost want to invite him to join you at your table.

Then there is our Angel, yes Angel is her name.  Angel is such a delightful waitress.  Aside from her sparkling personality, she will ensure that your order is correct and on time.

.

data.title: Great Chinese Eatery
data.text:
We dine at this establishment weekly.  The food is healthy, fresh and tasty.
One of the best Lobster sauces I have had.
